subject: Real Estate
title: Ireland's Celtic Tiger Collapse
description: Learn Ireland's Celtic Tiger Collapse in one minute.

hook.text: Ireland's home prices tripled between 1997 and 2007. Then they fell 50% in three years.

buildup.text: EU membership brought cheap credit. Irish banks lent furiously, and construction became the economy.

discovery.text: At the peak, Ireland was building more homes per capita than any nation in Europe.

twist.text: When the bubble burst, the government guaranteed all bank debts â€” socializing $64 billion in losses.

climax.text: Ireland went from Europe's miracle economy to requiring an international bailout in under three years.

punchline.text: A decade of growth vanished in a single guarantee.
